subtitles.text: From my point of view, he's great at variety, but he's also a great singer.
I'm a great variety singer, and I've been doing music since I was an idol.
I've also been acting since I was an idol.
I'm often asked which is what I really want to do. Like, "Which is what you really want to do?
I get asked that a lot. Yes, I get asked that a lot.
Of course music is important to me, and I want to do it,
But I don't have to choose everything, do I? I'm just doing it in a casual way,
How much do you think about that?

If I had to choose whether I want to do it or not, I would say I want to do it all. If I say I want to do anything, it might sound rude to all the jobs I do, so I try my best not to say that, but I started out in acting, but before that I was in bands all the time, even when I was a student.
I don't usually watch a lot of movies or practice acting.
Oh, I see.
Not at all.
I started playing music when I was in junior high school, and I started reading audition forms for the entertainment industry, you know?
I would send in a barrage of audition magazines.
I would go to Tokyo by myself and go to the office and do the "kon-kon-kon.
Send it out like this.
And they said, "Please don't do that.
I had my own office.
I had my first office when I was in high school.
They just said, "Okay," and that was it, but at that time
But at that time, you were doing it right.
You did it.

Because I know about variety
Because they know about variety
Because they know about variety

Well, I had been a big promoter of idol events and stuff like that, and I was doing mc and stuff like that, and I was talking a lot, and I guess she saw that, and she said it was a night when women get mad at women.
And then there was an audition, and they were looking for new girls.
I think there were about 50 to 100 people? They had an audition.
And I went to it. I came to Biri Idol.
I went in there and I said bad things about them.
I talked a lot, and I talked a lot about other people,
And then I passed the audition and got out, so that's new again.
I did music and acting,
I thought I was going to be in a music group like Puffy for a long time, but then variety came along.
And then, by chance, Billy Idol ran out of money and was told that they were breaking up.
Oh, it's the money.
Yeah, well, I guess it didn't work out.
So it kind of ends.
But it's a good thing it's over, because Corona's here.
Oh, I see.
If Corona had come in, it probably would have been a sadder end.
I don't think we would have been able to do any gigs.
Is that when you left?
I left before Corona, too. Right around that time.
I don't want to say that I've done everything I can, but even in the idol world, it would be nice if I could make it into something like the "anything era".
It would be nice if we could make it into something like the "what-if" era.
That's exactly what I did with V-S.
I was able to make Al.
Yeah, yeah.
So I think I've already made a break.
I've come to the end of my rope.
I had no choice but to quit.
I had no choice but to quit.
I'd already lost my mind.
Yeah, yeah.
I quit.
I quit music, variety, acting...
I quit because I didn't want to do anything else.
I quit because I didn't want to do anything else.
You mean you're thinking of going back to a normal life?
Yes, I'm going to go back to a reclusive life.
I don't really have a choice, I'm just doing whatever comes my way.
But my original reason for doing this is because I'm an actor, and I'm glad that I'm doing so many dramas now.
Anochan, did you start working on Vassar's drama after Corona?
That was before Corona.
When I was an idol for the first time.
During "Iramemon"?
Yes, that's right.
Oh, really?
I only remember that acting is very difficult.
You had to do the same thing over and over again?
Yes, it was.
I think it was so hard, but it was over in such a short period of time.
When I look at my parents.

Yes, he was a normal guy.
Unexpectedly, yes.
That was difficult. Was it difficult? He was trying really hard.
I blink a lot, so who's going to tell me not to blink?
I was asked to be a regular nail artist because I was becoming a ram, and it was such a small role, but it was tough.
But I was looking at it, and I was thinking that if they really wanted me to play a normal person, the director would probably have drawn me as that normal person.
That was great.
The result was a slightly different nail style.
Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.
It was the first role where I didn't die.
Before that, I'd played all deaths.
I played ghosts and dead people.
You're right, I did die.
Yes, I was dead.

Ano, you have your own name, Ano, and you have another band, right? You have different songs and different things, but you're still the same person. So, even if Ano performs as a solo artist, she might have a band, for example.
The result is the same. The nature is the same.

I don't know, I don't know.
The solo one, really, yeah.
I wonder if there is a God.
I don't know if there is a God or not.

It's the same with my private life.
I've had many experiences that made me think that God doesn't exist.
And when that happens, I think to myself, "Why don't I just become God?
That's what I'm trying to do.
I feel like no one is watching.
I'm trying to wrap everything up, and when I'm in the band, I feel like everything is melting.
I want to wrap it all up around me.
No substance?
It's melting and dissolving.
It's all dripping.
It's a place where it all drips and explodes as an emotion.
Wow.

I know, it's hard, but that's what it feels like.

might be a part of it.
